## SVG & CANVAS

Post._content:
`VScode` debug `.Net Core` 
<!--more-->

##  `C#`

 `C#` plugin

![](http://i965.photobucket.com/albums/ae138/anny09117011/Blog/2017-12-25_1355.png "VScode")

`VScode`  `OmniSharp`

![ OmniSharp ](http://i965.photobucket.com/albums/ae138/anny09117011/Blog/2017-12-25_1356.png "VScode")

## 

 `Program.cs` `VScode`  `Yes`

Post.title: Webpack 3 Tutorial - HTML Webpack Plugin
Post._content:
`HTML Webpack Plugin` `html`  `app.bundle.js`  `html` 
<!--more-->

##  `HTML Webpack Plugin`

```npm
npm i -D html-webpack-plugin
```

##  `webpack.config.js`

```js
var HtmlWebpackPlugin = require('html-webpack-plugin'); //  html-webpack-plugin
var path = require('path');

module.exports = {
entry: './src/app.js',
output: {

  path: path.resolve(__dirname, 'dist'),
  // the target directory for all output files
  // must be an absolute path (use the Node.js path module)

  filename: 'app.bundle.js'
  // the filename template for entry chunks

},

plugins: [new HtmlWebpackPlugin()] //  html-webpack-plugin

}
```

##  `html`



```npm
npm run dev
```



```npm
npm run prod
```

 `dist`  `index.html` 

![dist  index.html](http://i965.photobucket.com/albums/ae138/anny09117011/Blog/2017-06-30_1615.png "dist/index.html")

##  html templates

 `html` 
 `pug` 
 `HTML Webpack Plugin` 


1.  `webpack.config.js`

```js
module.exports = {
  ...
  plugins: [
    new HtmlWebpackPlugin({
      title: 'Custom template', //  html 
      template: './src/index.html' // 
    })
  ]
  ...
}
```

2.  `html` 

 `src`  `index.html`
`<%= htmlWebpackPlugin.options.title %>`  `webpack.config.js` 

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <meta http-equiv="Content-type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8"/>
    <title><%= htmlWebpackPlugin.options.title %></title>
  </head>
  <body>
  </body>
</html>
```

3.  `html`



```npm
npm run dev
```



```npm
npm run prod
```

 `dist`  `index.html` 

![dist  index.html](http://i965.photobucket.com/albums/ae138/anny09117011/Blog/2017-06-30_1655.png "dist/index.html")

[github](https://github.com/Annilla/webpack_practice/tree/v1.1.0)  `pug`  `HTML Webpack Plugin` 

## 

* [HTML Webpack Plugin](https://github.com/jantimon/html-webpack-plugin)
* [Webpack HtmlWebpackPlugin](https://webpack.js.org/plugins/html-webpack-plugin/)

Post.title: .NET Core 2.0 SPA with Vue-Cli - Start New Project
Post._content:
`.Net Core` `IDE` `VScode` `.NET Core 2.0 MVC` + `vue-cli` `SPA` `HMR` (Hot Module Replacement) > `.NET Core` `template` `ASP.NET Core with Vue.js` `Bootstrap`, `Typescript` `.NET Core` `Vue` ## `.NET Core 2.0 MVC` 1. [.NET Command Line Interface](https://github.com/dotnet/cli) 2. Core MVC ```dotnet dotnet new 'ASP.NET Core Web App (Model-View-Controller)' ``` 3. `SPA` MVC ![](http://i965.photobucket.com/albums/ae138/anny09117011/Blog/2017-12-02_1006.png "") * `HomeController.cs` Controller `Index` `Error` ```C# using System; using System.Collections.Generic; using System.Diagnostics; using System.Linq; using System.Threading.Tasks; using Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc; using dotnet_core_vue_cli.Models; namespace dotnet_core_vue_cli.Controllers { public class HomeController : Controller { public IActionResult Index() { return View(); } public IActionResult Error() { return View(new ErrorViewModel { RequestId = Activity.Current?.Id ?? HttpContext.TraceIdentifier }); } } } ``` * `Index.cshtml` HTML ```html @{ ViewData["Title"] = "Home Page"; }

TEST

``` * `_Layout.cshtml` ```html @ViewData["Title"] - dotnet_core_vue_cli @RenderBody() @RenderSection("Scripts", required: false) ``` ```dotnet dotnet run ``` `http://localhost:5000` `Index.cshtml` TEST ![http://localhost:5000](http://i965.photobucket.com/albums/ae138/anny09117011/Blog/2017-12-02_1011.png "") ## `vue-cli` 1. `vue-cli` ```npm npm install -g vue-cli ``` 2. `vue` + `webpack` ```npm vue init webpack-simple ``` `vue-cli` ![vue-cli](http://i965.photobucket.com/albums/ae138/anny09117011/Blog/2017-12-02_1018.png "vue-cli") ```npm npm install ``` `Node` `Vue` ```npm npm run dev ``` `http://localhost:8080` `vue` ![http://localhost:8080](http://i965.photobucket.com/albums/ae138/anny09117011/Blog/2017-12-02_1024.png "") > ?! `vue` `node server` `.NET server` `Development` `node server` (`JS`, `Css`, `images`...) ; `Production` `.NET server` ## `.NET Core` `Vue` 1. `webpack.config.js` `wwwroot` ```js ...... module.exports = { entry: { main: './src/main.js' }, output: { path: path.resolve(__dirname, './wwwroot'), publicPath: '/wwwroot/', filename: 'js/build.js' }, module: { rules: [ ...... { test: /\.(png|jpg|gif|svg)$/, loader: 'file-loader', options: { publicPath: '/', outputPath: 'imgs/', name: '[name].[ext]?[hash]' } } ] }, ...... } ...... ``` 2. `cshtml` `js` `html` * `_Layout.cshtml` ```html @ViewData["Title"] - dotnet_core_vue_cli @RenderBody() @RenderSection("Scripts", required: false) ``` * `Index.cshtml` ```html @{ ViewData["Title"] = "Home Page"; }
``` `.NET server` ```npm npm run build ``` ```dotnet dotnet run ``` ![http://localhost:5000](http://i965.photobucket.com/albums/ae138/anny09117011/Blog/2017-12-02_1110.png "") ## `HMR` `vue router` fallback `HMR` !!! `HMR` google 1. `aspnet-webpack`, `webpack-hot-middleware` ```npm npm i -D aspnet-webpack ``` ```npm npm i -D webpack-hot-middleware ``` 2. `ASP.NET Core SPA Services` ```npm dotnet add package Microsoft.AspNetCore.SpaServices --version 2.0.1 ``` 3. `Startup.cs` ```C# using Microsoft.AspNetCore.SpaServices.Webpack; ...... // This method gets called by the runtime. Use this method to configure the HTTP request pipeline. public void Configure(IApplicationBuilder app, IHostingEnvironment env) { // [HMR] http://www.c-sharpcorner.com/article/using-hot-module-replacement-feature-of-webpack-in-asp-net-core/ if (env.IsDevelopment()) { app.UseDeveloperExceptionPage(); app.UseWebpackDevMiddleware(new WebpackDevMiddlewareOptions { HotModuleReplacement = true }); } ...... app.UseMvc(routes => { routes.MapRoute( name: "default", template: "{controller=Home}/{action=Index}/{id?}"); // Use Vue Router must add fallback route // Help to navigate directly // https://stu.ratcliffe.io/2017/07/20/vuejs-serverside-rendering-with-aspnet-core routes.MapSpaFallbackRoute("spa-fallback", new { controller = "Home", action = "Index" }); }); } ...... ``` 4. `package.json` HMR ```json { ...... "scripts": { "hmr": "cross-env ASPNETCORE_ENVIRONMENT=Development NODE_ENV=development dotnet run", "dev": "cross-env NODE_ENV=development webpack-dev-server --open --hot", "build": "cross-env NODE_ENV=production webpack --progress --hide-modules" }, ...... } ``` ```npm npm run hmr ``` `Chrome` `HMR` ![http://localhost:5000](http://i965.photobucket.com/albums/ae138/anny09117011/Blog/2017-12-02_1249.png "") [github](https://github.com/Annilla/dotnet-core-vue-cli/tree/v1.0.0) ## * [Modern Web Development using ASP.NET Core template, Vue.js and Webpack](http://www.dotnetcurry.com/aspnet/1383/modern-web-dev-aspnet-core-webpack-vuejs) * [Using Hot Module Replacement Feature Of Webpack In ASP.NET Core](http://www.c-sharpcorner.com/article/using-hot-module-replacement-feature-of-webpack-in-asp-net-core/) * [Microsoft.AspNetCore.SpaServices](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.AspNetCore.SpaServices/)
Post.raw:

``` `.NET server` ```npm npm run build ``` ```dotnet dotnet run ``` ![http://localhost:5000](http://i965.photobucket.com/albums/ae138/anny09117011/Blog/2017-12-02_1110.png "") ## `HMR` `vue router` fallback `HMR` !!! `HMR` google 1. `aspnet-webpack`, `webpack-hot-middleware` ```npm npm i -D aspnet-webpack ``` ```npm npm i -D webpack-hot-middleware ``` 2. `ASP.NET Core SPA Services` ```npm dotnet add package Microsoft.AspNetCore.SpaServices --version 2.0.1 ``` 3. `Startup.cs` ```C# using Microsoft.AspNetCore.SpaServices.Webpack; ...... // This method gets called by the runtime. Use this method to configure the HTTP request pipeline. public void Configure(IApplicationBuilder app, IHostingEnvironment env) { // [HMR] http://www.c-sharpcorner.com/article/using-hot-module-replacement-feature-of-webpack-in-asp-net-core/ if (env.IsDevelopment()) { app.UseDeveloperExceptionPage(); app.UseWebpackDevMiddleware(new WebpackDevMiddlewareOptions { HotModuleReplacement = true }); } ...... app.UseMvc(routes => { routes.MapRoute( name: "default", template: "{controller=Home}/{action=Index}/{id?}"); // Use Vue Router must add fallback route // Help to navigate directly // https://stu.ratcliffe.io/2017/07/20/vuejs-serverside-rendering-with-aspnet-core routes.MapSpaFallbackRoute("spa-fallback", new { controller = "Home", action = "Index" }); }); } ...... ``` 4. `package.json` HMR ```json { ...... "scripts": { "hmr": "cross-env ASPNETCORE_ENVIRONMENT=Development NODE_ENV=development dotnet run", "dev": "cross-env NODE_ENV=development webpack-dev-server --open --hot", "build": "cross-env NODE_ENV=production webpack --progress --hide-modules" }, ...... } ``` ```npm npm run hmr ``` `Chrome` `HMR` ![http://localhost:5000](http://i965.photobucket.com/albums/ae138/anny09117011/Blog/2017-12-02_1249.png "") [github](https://github.com/Annilla/dotnet-core-vue-cli/tree/v1.0.0) ## * [Modern Web Development using ASP.NET Core template, Vue.js and Webpack](http://www.dotnetcurry.com/aspnet/1383/modern-web-dev-aspnet-core-webpack-vuejs) * [Using Hot Module Replacement Feature Of Webpack In ASP.NET Core](http://www.c-sharpcorner.com/article/using-hot-module-replacement-feature-of-webpack-in-asp-net-core/) * [Microsoft.AspNetCore.SpaServices](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.AspNetCore.SpaServices/)

Post.title: Webpack 3 Tutorial - Installation and Config
Post._content:
#  Webpack ?

`Webpack` `html`, `css`, `js`, `sass`, `pug`, `babel`, ... etc. `webpack` assets,`Babel`, `ES6`
<!--more-->

## 

1.  [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/en/)

2.  `npm` 

```npm
npm init
```
 package.json

```js
{
  "name": "Your Project Name",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "Webpack project.",
  "main": "index.js",
  "scripts": {
    "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1",
  },
  "author": "Your Name",
  "license": "ISC",
}
```

3.  Webpack
(global)

```npm
npm -g i webpack
```
> `webpack`global



```npm
npm i -D webpack
```

## 

 src  dist 

* src: 
* dist: `webpack` 
* src/app.js:  `js`  `webpack` 

app.js  console 

```js
console.log('Hello World!');
```

## 

1. `webpack.config.js`

```js
module.exports = {
  entry: './src/app.js',
  output: {
    filename: './dist/app.bundle.js'
  },
}
```

* entry: 
* output: 
  - filename: 

2. `package.json` `scripts`

```js
{
  ...
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "webpack -d --watch",
    "prod": "webpack -p"
  },
  ...
}
```

* -d:  minify js
* --watch: 
* -p:  minify js

##  webpack 

1. `package.json``script` dev

```npm
npm run dev
```

-  `dist` `app.bundle.js` minify

2. `package.json``script` prod

```npm
npm run prod
```

-  `dist` `app.bundle.js` minify

 webpack  Ihatetomatoes  YOUTUBE [Webpack 2 Tutorial - Installation and Config](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JdGnYNtuEtE&index=1&list=PLkEZWD8wbltnRp6nRR8kv97RbpcUdNawY) :)

> 2017/06/30 Webpack  3   3 [github](https://github.com/Annilla/webpack_practice/tree/v1.0.0) 3

#  Webpack ?

`Webpack` `html`, `css`, `js`, `sass`, `pug`, `babel`, ... etc. `webpack` assets,`Babel`, `ES6`
<!--more-->

## 

1.  [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/en/)

2.  `npm` 

```npm
npm init
```
 package.json

```js
{
  "name": "Your Project Name",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "Webpack project.",
  "main": "index.js",
  "scripts": {
    "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1",
  },
  "author": "Your Name",
  "license": "ISC",
}
```

3.  Webpack
(global)

```npm
npm -g i webpack
```
> `webpack`global



```npm
npm i -D webpack
```

## 

 src  dist 

* src: 
* dist: `webpack` 
* src/app.js:  `js`  `webpack` 

app.js  console 

```js
console.log('Hello World!');
```

## 

1. `webpack.config.js`

```js
module.exports = {
  entry: './src/app.js',
  output: {
    filename: './dist/app.bundle.js'
  },
}
```

* entry: 
* output: 
  - filename: 

2. `package.json` `scripts`

```js
{
  ...
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "webpack -d --watch",
    "prod": "webpack -p"
  },
  ...
}
```

* -d:  minify js
* --watch: 
* -p:  minify js

##  webpack 

1. `package.json``script` dev

```npm
npm run dev
```

-  `dist` `app.bundle.js` minify

2. `package.json``script` prod

```npm
npm run prod
```

-  `dist` `app.bundle.js` minify

thumbnailImagePosition: left

coverMeta: out
tags: [Webpack]
date: 2017/09/02
updated: 2017/09/02
---

 `webpack-dev-server` `Hot Reload` 
<!--more-->

##  `webpack-dev-server`

```npm
npm i -D webpack-dev-server
```

##  `webpack.config.js`

```js
module.exports = {
  ......
  devServer: {
    contentBase: path.join(__dirname, "dist"), // 
    port: 9000 // http://localhost:9000
  },
  ......
};
```

##  `package.json`

```js
{
  ......
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "webpack-dev-server --open",
    ......
  },
  ......
}
```

* --open: 

 `npm` 
```npm
npm run dev
```



![ npm run dev](http://i965.photobucket.com/albums/ae138/anny09117011/Blog/2017-09-02_0927.png "dist/index.html")

 `css`   `Hot Reload` 

> Live ReloadHot Reload:;

##  `Hot Reload`

 `src/app.scss`

```css
body {
    background-color: yellowgreen;
    h1 {
        color: green;
        // transform: scale(1.5);
    }
}
```

 `webpack-dev-server` code

![Hot Reload](http://i965.photobucket.com/albums/ae138/anny09117011/Blog/2017-09-02_0928.png "dist/index.html")

[github](https://github.com/Annilla/webpack_practice/tree/v1.3.0)

* [Webpack Dev Server Configuration](https://webpack.js.org/configuration/dev-server/)

* [React Native Hot Reload](http://www.jianshu.com/p/1fa6e9c0799f)

Post.title: Webpack 3 Tutorial - add PUG templates to write html
Post._content:
`pug-loader` `PUG`  `html`
<!--more-->

##  `pug-loader`

```npm
npm i -D pug pug-loader
```

##  `webpack.config.js`

```js
......

module.exports = {
  ......
  module: {
    rules: [
      ......
      {
        test: /\.pug$/,
        use: 'pug-loader'
      }
    ]
  },
  ......
}
```

##  `index.pug`

 `index.html`  `index.pug` `Pug` 

```pug
doctype html
html(lang="en")
  head
    title= pageTitle
    script(type='text/javascript').
      if (foo) bar(1 + 5)
  body
    h1 Pug - node template engine
    #container.col
      if youAreUsingPug
        p You are amazing
      else
        p Get on it!
      p.
        Pug is a terse and simple templating language with a
        strong focus on performance and powerful features.
```

 `webpack.config.js` plugin  `HtmlWebpackPlugin`  `Pug` 

```js
module.exports = {
  ......
  plugins: [
    new HtmlWebpackPlugin({
      template: './src/index.pug'
    }),
    ......
  ]
}
```

 `npm run dev` `Pug` 

![ npm run dev ](http://i965.photobucket.com/albums/ae138/anny09117011/Blog/2017-10-28_1131.png "dist/index.pug")

 [Github](https://github.com/Annilla/webpack_practice/tree/v1.5.0) 

## 

* [pug-loader](https://github.com/pugjs/pug-loader)
* [Pug](https://github.com/pugjs/pug)
